topic: The Axial Skeleton: The Rib Cage
intro: The Rib Cage consists of 12 pairs of curved bones that protect the heart and lungs.
notes: Sternum: The flat breastbone where ribs attach at the front.
Cartilage: Flexible tissue that allows the chest to expand during breathing.
Thoracic Vertebrae: The 12 bones of the spine where ribs attach at the back.
Floating Ribs: The last 2 pairs of ribs that do not attach to the Sternum.

hotspots.label: Ribs
hotspots.info: 12 pairs of bones forming a protective cage.

hotspots.label: Sternum
hotspots.info: Flat bone at the front of the chest.

hotspots.label: Cartilage
hotspots.info: Flexible tissue that aids in breathing.
